intro: Bolbidium polyanthum, commonly known as the many-flowered bolbidium, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky outcrops. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, with a central disk surrounded by ray florets. Bolbidium polyanthum is often found in arid or semi-arid regions and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
